title: Red Velvet Crinkle Cookies Recipe
description: Perfect for the holidays, red velvet crinkle cookies are deliciously chewy with a delicately crinkled crust and a dusting of powdered sugar.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Red Velvet Crinkle Cookies 4.5 (67) 57 Reviews 34 Photos These chewy red velvet crinkle cookies are deep red in color with a delicate, crackled crust dusted with a touch of powdered sugar. Store in an airtight container with waxed paper or parchment paper separating each layer. Submitted by Duncan HinesR Canada Updated on June 1, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 34 34 34 34 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Additional Time: 20 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 48 Yield: 48 cookies Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 48 servings 1 (15.25 ounce) box Duncan Hines red velvet cake mix 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and cooled 2 large eggs 1 teaspoon lemon zest 1 cup powdered sugar 1 teaspoon cornstarch Directions Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Mix cake mix, cooled butter, eggs, and lemon zest by hand in large mixing bowl until well blended and a dough forms. Mix powdered sugar and cornstarch together with a fork in a shallow dish until blended. Form dough into 1-inch balls and roll in powdered sugar mixture. Place about 2 inches apart onto cool, ungreased baking sheets. Bake one sheet at a time in the center of the preheated oven until set, 9 to 11 minutes. Cool for 1 minute on the baking sheet, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely, about 15 more minutes. Repeat to bake remaining cookies. I Made It Print 219 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Red Velvet Crinkle Cookies 01 of 34 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 34 Photo by  Keith Skiner 03/20/2022 I just made these fir the 2nd time. This I took the advise from a post on here on deleted the lemon zest and added 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder and 1/2 tsp vanilla. Good call! I also kept the dough chilled this time and use a 1 tbls cookie baller and the results where perfection 03 of 34 Photo by  steve s 07/26/2020 04 of 34 Photo by  Sharlee Bourbonais 03/25/2020 05 of 34 Photo by  TORRA 12/26/2019 06 of 34 Photo by  Shannon Leonard 12/22/2019 I thought these were super easy to make and delicious! Beware they do stain your hands. I had lots of compliments and will make them again. I even added white chocolate chips in the cookies. 07 of 34 Photo by  kaitlyn pomponio 04/15/2019 08 of 34 Photo by  Ellie Lahey 02/09/2019 09 of 34 Photo by  Joyce Chung 01/23/2019 10 of 34 Photo by  Nette1 12/24/2018 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Red Velvet and White Chocolate Chunk Cookies 1 Rating Lemon Whippersnappers 107 Ratings Red Velvet Snowflake Cookies Dawn's Easy Red Velvet Sandwich Cookies 158 Ratings Cinnamon Crinkles 3 Ratings Homemade Chocolate Sandwich Cookies 215 Ratings Gloreo Cookies 5 Ratings Chocolate Mint Crinkle Cookies from Reynolds® Parchment Paper 3 Ratings Earthquake Cookies 234 Ratings Clever Cake Mix Crinkle Cookies 15 Ratings Easy Thanksgiving Cookies 12 Ratings Banana Split-Flavored Funfetti Cookies Red Velvet Cake Mix Cookies 41 Ratings Pumpkin Cake Mix Cookies 1 Rating Crinkles 9 Ratings Yummy Chocolate Crinkle Cookies 42 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Duncan HinesR Canada
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).;Mix cake mix, cooled butter, eggs, and lemon zest by hand in large mixing bowl until well blended and a dough forms.;Mix powdered sugar and cornstarch together with a fork in a shallow dish until blended.;Form dough into 1-inch balls and roll in powdered sugar mixture. Place about 2 inches apart onto cool, ungreased baking sheets.;Bake one sheet at a time in the center of the preheated oven until set, 9 to 11 minutes. Cool for 1 minute on the baking sheet, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely, about 15 more minutes. Repeat to bake remaining cookies.
